722991f-a.title: Manhattan: Rivington Street - Columbia Street
722991f-a.text:
Rivington Street, north side, at Columbia Street. The view shows
the De Witt Momorial Church at No. 280 Rivington Street, between Columbia
and Cannon Streets. These buildings are reported to be over congested;
1 building having 98 people in 62 rooms.
NEG ~ 34-45  About 1920.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
722991f-a.folder: Rivington Street & Columbia Street, Manhattan, NY

732927f-a.title: Social conditions - [Interior of a three-room apartment.]
732927f-a.text:
Social Conditions in Manhattan: The interior of a 3 room apartment
at No. 262 Rivington Street, showing the qquarters occupied by a father
and mother, 8 children and a boarder- 11 in all. The foreground shows
the ''dining room'' with two beds (one folding) and an ice box denoting
the rooms original purpose. Through the kitchen, one comes upon the bed-
room; a small space, two-thirds of which is occupied by its only furnishing.
Note the attempt to make this crowded flat an attractive, clean home.
November 15, 1923.
Cqift of New York World.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
Neg. ~ 2474

EA5NeS

733295f-a.title: Street scenes - Cigar store - Indian.
733295f-a.text:
125 Columbia Street, east side, south of Kane Street, showing a wooden
indian, once commonly usod to indicate a cigar store.
August 10, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

719050f-a.title: Manhattan: Columbia Street - Rivington Street
719050f-a.text:
68 to 72 Columbia Strect, east side, south of Rivington
Street, showing prominently the synagogue of the Gongregation
Ahavath Achim Ansche Ungarn at No. 70. At the left margin is
a portion of No. 74, the tenement at the S. E. corner of Rivington
Street.
NEG 2917
May 12, 1939
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

719051f-a.title: Manhattan: Columbia Street - Rivington Street
719051f-a.text:
Tolumbia Street, east side, north from Rivirgton Street,
showing a glimpse of the connmested ghetto under the Williamsburg
Bridre. Note the pushcarts and the modern garbage removal truck
of tRe Department of Sanitation.
June 29, 1938.
P.L. Sperr
NO RPPRODUCTIONS.
View Ne. 2 is the sawe area at a later date. Note the vacant
spaces caused by recent temement demolitions.
May 12, 1939
P. L. Sperr
